cardData.question: The most important lesson I've learned as a designer is...
cardData.caption: it changes you as a person, especially the way you think and see the world. I started to question everything I’ve come across and also started to appreciate the value of things a lot more.

cardData.question: My design process is fueled by the belief that...
cardData.caption: intuitive, meaningful, inclusive, and not-so-complex solutions are answers to the complex problems

cardData.question: I imagine a world...
cardData.caption: where it is not humans against the environment but a place where we integrate and move closer to being more connected to nature.

cardData.question: I am particularly interested in...
cardData.caption: sustainability and how we can use technology to build more meaningful products, for us as well as the world around us.

cardData.question: My design process is fueled by the belief that...
cardData.caption: architecture transcends buildings; it influences society, culture, and human experiences.

cardData.question: The most important lesson I've learned as a designer is...
cardData.caption: balancing creativity with practicality ensures enduring, people-centric architectural solutions.

cardData.question: Proximity is...
cardData.caption: constantly in flux with the changes around us.

cardData.question: Designing for sustainability means...
cardData.caption: applying parametric design principles to create efficient and sustainable building solutions.

cardData.question: What would your TED Talk be about?
cardData.caption: Integration of parametric 3D modeling and simulation tools into Building Design.

cardData.question: What would be the impact of AI in Architecture?
cardData.caption: AI will eventually replace architects, if not design and emotion part anytime soon, atleast to a major extend of our functions in society. It does not imply the end of architects; rather, the scope of architects changes, integrating tech in design workflow,it evolves. Curation instead of creation.

Designed and developed innovative products in the household electrical appliance industry, with four products launched in the market, resulting in increased revenue of $ 1.2M. -Co-inventor for two patents applied in household water heating solution and garment-care segment.-Led a project on improving food hygiene, collaborating with engineering, marketing, and outside customer stakeholders.
edesigned hydraulic manifold blocks for Additive Manufacturing using CFD analysis, achieving a 71% reduction in weight and a 12.5% reduction in pressure drop.

Design focus on Residential Projects at Robbins

WebVR experience of interiors with focus on interactivity.

Working on achieving sustainble residential and commercial design. Researching on various computational design workflows intersecting with traditional india architecture. Working on various levels of interior and execution projects
Worked on DST project for creating digital heritage of representative architectural marvels from each states of Northeast India.

cardData.degree: Master of Design, Emerging Technologies and Product Design
cardData.description: MDes Distinguished Scholar Award.  The Berkeley Master of Design (Berkeley MDes) is a professional graduate program in design for emerging technologies. MDes emphasizes critical design and social practice to address the new realities of emerging technologies in the 21st century and prepares students for work at the intersection of technology and design.

cardData.degree: BTech + MTech (Integrated Dual Degree), Engineering Design
cardData.description: Activities and societies: Part of Institute Basketball team 2015-2018,Shaastra- Sponsorship & PR team/Media & Photography team, Co-founding team member, Feeding India, Chennai Chapter. Minor- Sustainable Infrastructure & Environmental Management
Blend of architectural design with cutting-edge technology to bring creative visions to life.
Laid foundations to Architecture Design and concept development.

cardData.degree: Master's Degree in Parametric Design in Architecture
cardData.description: As a student in the UPC School MPDA Master’s degree program in Parametric Design in Architecture, I worked on applying parametric design principles to create efficient and sustainable building solutions. Through practical workshops and real-world applications, I gained experience in using advanced software tools and integrating diverse disciplines such as BIM, urban design, and climate analysis into the design process. The program provided me with the skills and knowledge needed to become a builder of efficient and sustainable architectural systems, contributing to a more sustainable built environment.
A strong foundation in architecture, enabling a comprehensive understanding of innovative design principles and architectural concepts.

cardData.title: Mycorrhizae
cardData.description: Mycorrhizae is an interactive exhibit highlighting the hidden communication between plants, mushrooms, and the underground forest ecosystem, known as the Mycorrhizal network.

cardData.title: Teach Green Toys
cardData.description: UHow do we improve access and exposure to climate change for students at an early age through engaging in educational play, creating an educating and knowledgeable future society?

cardData.title: Built with Speed
cardData.description: The brief of competition being the develope stratergies for faster construction techinques, the proposal taps in the power of computation and data driven design to generate the modules of apartments which are site and context driven.

cardData.title: AI Renderer
cardData.description: TRendering being the most used visualization for end users of AEC market and blooming VR experience to enchance the experience of the space before actualization. We intend to develop a cloud workflow to generate web based 3d experiece. One product that can be viewed through different tech mediums and interactive experience.

cardData.title: Origami Opening
cardData.description: Inspired from deployable origami, the idea was a element which can open and close based on the contextual awareness of light and sun.

cardData.title: 3D Print Joinery
cardData.description: The idea was to develop an algorithm which can generate multi angles joinery for different discrete elements to form a shell. The projects explore the circularity of the construction materials to reuse and bring them back to life.

cardData.title: Interior Web VR
cardData.description: Rendering being the most used visualization for end users of AEC market and blooming VR experience to enhance the experience of the space before actualization. We intend to develop a cloud workflow to generate web based 3D experiece. One product that can be viewed through different tech mediums and interactive experience.

cardData.title: Twisted Pavilion
cardData.description: This is a exploration of Toyo Ito's pavilion to understand the parametric and fabrication techniques

cardData.title: Eco - Catalyst
cardData.description: Our bridge focuses on providing an architectural solution for this by re-activating nature in Biscayne Bay. Located in the south of Miami - in Biscayne Bay, the bridge acts as a natural barrier between the Atlantic Ocean and the inland areas of Florida, protecting and rejuvenating the outer coastline. Using the ecology of Florida - such as mangroves provides an area for local birds to nest and migrate to in the winter, thereby catalyzing the ecosystem of the area. The bridge design is a prototype, built in multiples until it meets the mainland of Miami city.

cardData.title: China Town Market
cardData.description: The Modern China Town Market will serve as a Translucent screening between the CTA station and the inscrutable neighbourhood context. The market is situated to the south of the crowded intersection and the uncongested street to the north. So as to provide the market carter with breathing room for the mixed personalities. The notion of metamorphosis would highlight the perception of evolving traditional and new shopping values. As a location surrounded by the CTA line and residential area, it will offer a large variety of travellers and commuters.

cardData.title: Urban Mosque
cardData.description: Mosque having a simple definition and purpose, it has been evolved and explored throughout the world. Mosque had a greater regional influence throughout the world. But in the later times mosque was not only a place of worship, it has become a mix of function and served as a community place in the society. Hence my inquiry is understanding the act of praying ( namaz ) in a mosque in contemporary times by rejuvenating the idea and concepts of Islam and translate it into architecture.

cardData.title: Understanding Proximity
cardData.description: The beginning of this project started out with three different versions of proximity. Proximity to the urban context; Proximity to each other; and proximity through screens and the response to the covid 19 pandemic. These were all incorporated into the strategy. The main focus became incorporating the building into one neighborhood. The basis of this came from the book Life Between Buildings by Jan Gehl. The removing of a corner of the building starts at the ground level. This opens the building to the urban fabric of the neighborhood. The building is separated into groups of four floors.

cardData.title: CCF Workshop
cardData.description: This design is based on the workshop I attended at Charles Correa Foundation. The aim of the workshop was to understand the housing and it's parameter at an urban scale. Based on the learnings from the workshop this design was developed as a part of workshop culmination. It aims to apply ideologies of Ar. Charles Correa in today's context.

cardData.question: My all time favorite designer is...
cardData.caption: Zaha Hadid. I followed her work for the entire duration of my time as an undergrad. Listening to her lectures, interviews, and following her work gave me a lot of inspiration and energy to continue to push the boundaries of architecture.

cardData.question: My design process is fueled by the belief that...
cardData.caption: buildings and the design of spaces are a product of its place and time and reflect its inherent emotions.

cardData.question: The most important lesson I've learned as a designer is...
cardData.caption: the built fabric correlates to its geographic, socio-economic and political setting.

cardData.question: Designing for sustainability means...
cardData.caption: addressing fundamental issues like access to safe drinking water.

cardData.question: What would your TED Talk be about?
cardData.caption: Mobility, cities and people.

cardData.question: The most fulfilling part of being a designer is...
cardData.caption: being able to analyse issues with different lenses.

Designing concepts, buildings and fashion!

cardData.position: Store Design Manager - US Licensed Stores
cardData.description: Licensed store design.

Managed the production of construction documents, overseeing both internal and external designers and consultants. I am accountable for ensuring the integrity and quality of construction documents, encompassing design intent, detailing, code compliance, scheduling, and MEPs.

Under the guidance of Architect Bijoy Ramachandran, I contributed to diverse projects, including interior architecture for a 60,000 sqft office space, interior design for Paradise Biriyani restaurants, and detailed working drawings for the Bangalore International Centre.

I lead the end-to-end design process for Starbucks stores, ensuring alignment with budget, schedule, and operational needs while upholding Starbucks' guiding principles. My responsibilities include design strategy execution, meeting deliverables, budget compliance, documentation management, and cross-functional collaboration.
Licensed store design.

I collaborated with a multidisciplinary team, gaining hands-on experience in sustainable transportation projects and policy advocacy. This experience deepened my commitment to creating greener, more livable cities and broadened my perspective on the complex challenges of urban development in India.

Independent consultant to Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) as part of the Sustainable Urban Development-Smart Cities (SUDC-SC) Initiative in Kochi, India to develop an integrated planning framework, canal edge masterplan, participatory toolkit, sub-site design detailing and a pilot DPR for the Mullaserry Canal and adjacent region. The project supports the national Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs and the State Government of Kerala in policy formulation on housing for all, basic services, planning framework, and monitoring of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

It was a transformative journey that allowed me to delve deeper into the avant-garde and experimental realms of architecture. I was exposed to cutting-edge design theories, unconventional approaches, and a creative freedom that pushed the boundaries of traditional architectural norms. The rigorous curriculum challenged me to think critically, to break free from convention, and to redefine the very essence of architecture.
This was my introduction into the world of Architecture where I first explored space and form.

cardData.degree: Master of Science, Urban and Regional Planning
cardData.description: Through extensive research, I delved into the multifaceted challenges of urban and regional development, examining critical issues in European nations and the Global South. This program not only honed my skills as a planner but also instilled a deep understanding of various planning cultures. Furthermore, I acquired proficiency in research methodologies tailored to the fields of urban studies and planning, with a strong emphasis on integrating environmental considerations into urban development strategies.

Gold Medallist and Student President of Archilogue (2015-16). Archilogue is the technical society of students in Dept. of Architecture and conducts events for the students to involve and explore the city.

I explored the complexities of urban systems, focusing on sustainable solutions for pressing urban challenges. This educational journey equipped me with the skills and knowledge to pursue my lifelong mission of understanding and enhancing cities as an Urbanist in Rotterdam.

I was an industrious student focused on academic excellence, while actively participating in co-curricular and extracurricular activities in the college. Monsoon Assemblages - part of a design-driven enquiry into the impacts of changing monsoon climates in Chennai. It was a combined studio with the DS18 in the University of Westminster.

cardData.title: B-Side
cardData.description: B-Side was one of four design studios that students took part in for the Making+Meaning 2021 Summer digital design program at SCI-Arc; the design workshop investigated optical effects by simultaneously exploring form, material, and light. The start point for the section looked at the 3D extrusion of various fonts of the Alphabet B. Every stage involved creating and evolving a 3D singular object, and participants played with various optical materials, lights, and the camera to create fantastical effects.

cardData.title: Urban Fabric Rugs
cardData.description: Urban Fabric Rugs creates abstracted depictions of our built environments by taking flat urban street grids and conveying them in extruded reliefs with soft hand-knotted and carved wool and silk. Each Urban Fabric Rug attempts to illustrate the uniqueness the city depicted. The compositions, together with the selected colors, celebrate this uniqueness and convey a sense of place.

cardData.title: Evergrande Stadium
cardData.description: The Guangzhou Stadium Complex for Evergrande, is interested in employing sinuous lines to create a new kind of entertainment experience. Characterized by a series of repeated organic curves, the building has a sense of elegant motion reminiscent of the complex choreography of the football game taking place within.

cardData.title: Ethereal
cardData.description: Ethereal was a Speculative Architectural research project that was a part of the 'Not Making Architecture' Studio Instructed by Hernan Diaz Alonso and Rachael McCall. The premise of the research studio was to steer away from traditional forms of exploration, design, and representation within architecture and to come up with unusual, absurd ways to explore architectural design. Ethereal explored the aesthetic of 'the magical' through a series of formal and visual compositing experiments, gradually evolving into a series of abstract, mysterious objects created through careful digital sculpting and simulations.

cardData.title: Fold Chair
cardData.description: Fold Chair is a 3D printed dining chair produced by Xuberance, Shanghai. The chair is available in wood or four colorways: pink, yellow, green, grey. The shape of the chair is based on a continuous form, printed on its side using advanced recycled plastic polymers or recycled wood. The pattern continuously wraps around the billowing surface, doubly curved for structural stability.

cardData.title: Kinetic
cardData.description: Kinetic was one of four design studios students participated in for the Making+Meaning 2023 Summer digital design program at SCI-Arc. This Making + Meaning section focused on exploring the concept of Kinetic (Motion) through Procedural Modeling and Animation in Cinema 4D (C4D).

cardData.title: Evergrande Residential
cardData.description: Facade studies for EverGRANDE Car Factory Residential and Reception, China. Project in collaboration with Xuberance.

cardData.title: Tableau Vivant - Cordova Gardens Facade
cardData.description: Tableau Vivant - Atelier Manferdini proposal for 350 Cordova consists of 10 custom tile mosaics - fusing form and colors, that occupy the curtain between the public garden and the internal courtyard. The overall subject matter of the artwork is a tree, that negotiates real and manmade nature, abstract and figural representation, and offers a contemporary interpretation of the genre of “Tableau Vivant” at the scale of a building façade.

cardData.title: inVisible - Dominion Energy Crystal Substation
cardData.description: inVisible - Atelier Manferdini proposal for Dominion Energy consists of two stacked expansive, frontal, bleeding fields—fusing form and colors, that divide horizontally the façade. The lower half represents a vibrant electric field, rendered in colorful ceramic tiles; the upper half represents a folded sky, carried out in monochrome metal panels. In between a single horizontal division of the facade that calls up associations with an unreachable horizon.

cardData.title: Starbucks - Glacier Basecamp Lodge
cardData.description: Stores in National Parks should blend into their natural surroundings while providing a shelter from the outdoor elements. The exterior of this store in Glacier National Park takes notes from the traditional ’70s log cabins found in the area. The interior emphasizes the coziness desired after a long hike, with a fireplace and warm lighting and finishes. A well-placed painting ties the mountains of coffee origin countries to the dramatic backdrop of the nearby Rockies.

cardData.title: Starbucks Pickup - Ohio State University
cardData.description: Starbucks first Licensed PickUp only store inside the OSU campus. The earthy calm palette coordinates with OSU's famous scarlet and gray school colors and makes the store feel warm and inviting.The heart of the store is the sculptural service counter. It was formed from a custom color corian with a shape wholly inspired by OSU's mascot - the Buckeye. The perimeter is clad in white oak slats and full height metal trim accentuated by smooth wood veneer to emphasize customer touch points.

cardData.title: Schuster Centre
cardData.description: The Schuster Perfoming Arts Center in downtown Dayton Ohio is the premier presenter and host for ats, culture and entertainment in this region. The store, located off of an impressive 6 story glass atrium spanning an entire city block designed by famed arhcitiect Cesar Pelli, is a busy pass through for business proffesionals and vistors. The design goal was to integrate with the existing architecture, particularly the shoji screen style sliding doors at our storefront. The palette was kept neutral, using white oak and light paint colors. The interior screens reveal a merch display, a lean on counter, a wordmark logo, and a coffee landscape photo printed on wood veneer.

cardData.title: LuOne Mall
cardData.description: The store is inside one of Shanghai's luxury shopping centers. The design creates an elevated cafe experience for the customers to take a break and relax or to casually hangout with friends.

cardData.title: Landscapes of India
cardData.description: A series of illustrations celebrating the varied Indian Landscapes.

cardData.title: Starbucks - Mandalay Bay
cardData.description: Renovation of an existing Starbucks store inside Mandalay Bay Resort, Las Vegas. The material palette including white oak wood, gold metal accents, a dynamic back bar tile pattern and a deep brown textured wall covering uplift the space to make it warm and inviting. Sweeping curves that run along the store creates visual movement and brings the whole store forward. The engine was expanded to support larger sales volume.

cardData.title: Degree Coffee - Kumbakonam Blend
cardData.description: Product labels inspired by locaton.

cardData.title: How to: deconstruct your favorite meal and reconstruct it as an ecosystem?
cardData.description: In this experimental course, we took our favorite dishes, deconstructed their constituent components, and retraced their origins to their source locations to understand the environmental costs of making the dish a reality.

cardData.title: Loops as Leverage
cardData.description: A Circular Framework To Co-Create A Sustainable Coimbatore.

cardData.title: Fieldbook for Chennai
cardData.description: A framework to explore Chennai, planned around the 44th Chess Olympiad held in the city.

cardData.title: How far can you go in 15 mins in the Netherlands?
cardData.description: About 1/3 of CO2 emissions and 1/4 of the air pollution in urban areas are caused by mobility and transport. It is extremely important to reduce this if we want to achieve our targets of net zero by 2050.

cardData.title: Jugaad Render
cardData.description: Jugaad Render is a free to use resource for architects and architecture students to bring their visualizations of unbuilt architecture to life in the Indian context.

cardData.title: A Speculative Cartographic Imagination of an India Along Ecoregions
cardData.description: The earth exists in a complex system of inter-related systems that have feedback loops with each other. It is inherently difficult for humans to comprehend this complexity. This lack of comprehension, coupled with our deterministic and simplistic models of how the world works from the past have generated a lot of the world’s troubles today.
